top_categories.workout_context: Karukinka rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Karukinka’s chilean tierra del fuego, south american gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Karukinka when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing Karukinka isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Karukinka. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 120 miles, Karukinka punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Karukinka’s 10,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Karukinka’s tierra del fuego mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Karukinka — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at Karukinka intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Karukinka’s 10,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Karukinka — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on tierra del fuego mountain gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Karukinka’s 120 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Karukinka. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Karukinka demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride tierra del fuego mountain gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: chilean tierra del fuego, south american gravel, regional event. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 120 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 120 miles of tierra del fuego mountain gravel in Tierra del Fuego, Chile.
